What this law (and it's counter-part) entail...
 
 On Tuesday, Gov. Jennifer Granholm publicly supported House Bill 5616 and Senate Bill 1156, which will require Michigan's approximately 750 K-12 public school districts and charter schools to have tough, anti-bullying policies that require at least these components:
 
  A statement prohibiting harassment or bullying of a pupil.
 
  A definition of harassment or bullying.
 
  A description of expected student behavior.
 
  Age-appropriate consequences for policy violators.
 
  Procedure for reporting harassment or bullying.
 
  Procedure for prompt investigation of reports or complaints about bullying.
 
  A range of ways a school will respond once harassment or bullying is identified.
 
  A statement prohibiting reprisals against those reporting harassment.
 
  Consequences and appropriate remedial action for those who have falsely accused another of harassment or bullying.
 
  A statement of how the policy is to be publicized.
 
  Provisions encouraging individuals to report harassment or bullying incidents.
